config.question: How does the study of ecology relate to humankind?

choices.content: Ecology is the study of how living organisms interact with the natural environment. As humans are living organisms, ecologists study how society interacts with the natural environment as well.

Ecology is similar to the study of sociology, only this field studies animals and plants rather than humans. However, ecologists can learn about the natural environment using tools and methods developed by studying humans.
Ecology studies how we can change our human societies to increase the degree of social equality.
Ecology was developed to study all the unanswered questions about human population growth and how it affects the natural environment.
